title: Ticket #1237: condor_schedd fsync()s UserLog multiple times on job removal
description:
Related to... 
commit 579dffc9e99b6b50cce342f5468b3b3b8c3a95fb
Author: Dan Bradley <dan@hep.wisc.edu>
Date:   Thu Feb 11 16:35:55 2010 -0600

    Only fsync user log once when writing multiple submit events.
    Previously, 'queue 100' caused 100 calls to fsync.

The Schedd will fsync the UserLog once for each job that is removed.

Watching the Schedd with... 

$ strace -c -efsync -p $(pidof condor_schedd)

Submission with no log file... 

$ time echo "cmd=/bin/true\nrequirements=false\nnotification=never\nqueue 100" | strace -c -efsync condor_submit
Submitting job(s)....................................................................................................
100 job(s) submitted to cluster 5.
echo "cmd=/bin/true\nrequirements=false\nnotification=never\nqueue 100"  0.00s user 0.00s system 113% cpu 0.002 total
strace -c -efsync condor_submit  0.08s user 0.14s system 48% cpu 0.458 total

Schedd fsync counts with no log file (after queue drained)... 

$ strace -c -efsync -p $(pidof condor_schedd)

^CProcess 24411 detached
% time     seconds  usecs/call     calls    errors syscall

  -nan    0.000000           0         2           fsync
------ ----------- ----------- --------- --------- ----------------
100.00    0.000000                     2           total

$ time echo "cmd=/bin/true\nlog=/tmp/log\nrequirements=false\nnotification=never\nqueue 10" | strace -c -efsync condor_submit

no log single log multiple logs
submit 0 1 n
schedd 2 n+2 n+2

Expected fsync counts for n jobs...
no log single log multiple logs
submit 0 1 n
schedd 2 1+2 n+2
remarks:
2010-Mar-17 10:37:38 by tstclair:
This may be related to the check_zombie issue we had seen when shadows exit prior to the schedd communicating. During reaping the schedd will execute check_zombie which then performs multiple fsyncs. It could easily be bundled under a single transaction.
